scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-TR-111 Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-TR-111 is a star with 0.82 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.83 times its radius. It is located 3484.42 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 8.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

OGLE-TR-111 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-TR-111 system


OGLE-TR-111 b

OGLE-TR-111 b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2004-10, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-TR-111 b is 174.900 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-TR-111 b is 11.422 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-TR-111 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system OGLE-TR-111, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-TR-111 - System With 1 Exoplanet
